ca.mcgill.ecse211.game

Class GameNavigation

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.game.GameNavigation

  • public class GameNavigation
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains higher-level navigation methods, such as methods that drive it from the starting point to the tunnel, through the tunnel, to the tree, around the tree searching for rings, back to the tunnel, and back to the starting point. It calls methods from the Navigation class and the RingSearcher class.
    Author:
    Lara, Romain, Matthew

      Returns a point by point path along the grid to get from one point to another on the main island.
      static int getTunnelOrientation(boolean ourTunnel)
      Returns the tunnel orientation of the input tunnel.
      private static boolean hasObstacle(int x, int y, int[][] obstacles)
      return whether a point contains an obstacle or is not within the main island
      int navAroundTree(int[][] obstacles, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> availableSides)
      Navigates to the nearest accessible tree side.
      static void navInTunnelFromIsland(int tunnelOrientation, int[][] obstacles)
      Navigates from a grid intersection near the entrance of the tunnel to the front of the tunnel, then to the main island through the tunnel, ending up 1 grid away from the exit
      static void navInTunnelToIsland(int tunnelOrientation, int[][] obstacles)
      Navigates the robot from 0.4 tiles from the entrance to the tunnel to 0.6 tiles out of the exit of the tunnel, then to the one of the two closest grid intersections (favouring the one that does not have an obstacle)
      void navToTunnel(int tunnelOrientation)
      navigates to the tunnel such that the robot ends up facing into the tunnel 0.4 tiles from the tunnel entrance
      static void treeToTunnel(int[] destination, int[][] obstacles)
      Navigates from the tree to the tunnel.
      static void tunnelToStart()
      Goes back to the start and then unloads any rings it is carrying; assumes that it is completely out of the tunnel and on the starting island
      static boolean tunnelToTree(int[] startCoords, int[][] obstacles, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> availableSides)
      This method navigates the robot to the closest available side on the tree (1 grid away).
      static void weirdFlexButOk()
      Plays a song

    • Method Detail

      • getTunnelOrientation

        public static int getTunnelOrientation(boolean ourTunnel)
        Returns the tunnel orientation of the input tunnel.
        Returns:
        integer representation of tunnel orientation: 1 = vertical & LL on starting island, 2 = vertical & LL on island, 3 = horizontal & LL on starting island, 4 = horizontal && LL on island

      • navToTunnel

        public void navToTunnel(int tunnelOrientation)
        navigates to the tunnel such that the robot ends up facing into the tunnel 0.4 tiles from the tunnel entrance
        Parameters:
        tunnelOrientation - 1 = vertical & LL on starting island, 2 = vertical & LL on island, 3 = horizontal & LL on starting island, 4 = horizontal && LL on island

      • navInTunnelToIsland

        public static void navInTunnelToIsland(int tunnelOrientation,
                                       int[][] obstacles)
        Navigates the robot from 0.4 tiles from the entrance to the tunnel to 0.6 tiles out of the exit of the tunnel, then to the one of the two closest grid intersections (favouring the one that does not have an obstacle)
        Parameters:
        tunnelOrientation - 1 = vertical & LL on starting island, 2 = vertical & LL on island, 3 = horizontal & LL on starting island, 4 = horizontal && LL on island
        obstacles - list of coordinates that the robot cannot travel on

      • getIslandObstacles

        public static int[][] getIslandObstacles()
        returns an 2d array with all of the obstacle coordinates: {tunnel1, tunnel2, opp_tunnel1, opp_tunnel2, tree, opp_tree} where each element is a coordinate pair {x, y}
        Returns:
        list of obstacle coordinates

      • hasObstacle

        private static boolean hasObstacle(int x,
                                   int y,
                                   int[][] obstacles)
        return whether a point contains an obstacle or is not within the main island
        Parameters:
        x - x position in grid tiles
        y - y position in grid tiles
        obstacles - list of coordinates the robot cannot travel on
        Returns:
        if the coordinate has an obstacle or is out of bounds

      • getShortestPath

        public static java.util.ArrayList<int[]> getShortestPath(int x1,
                                                         int y1,
                                                         int x2,
                                                         int y2,
                                                         int[][] obstacles,
                                                         boolean[][] visited)
        Returns a point by point path along the grid to get from one point to another on the main island. This method assumes that the end point is reachable, i.e. the path to it or the end point itself are not completely obstructed by obstacles; checking for this is a responsibility of the caller
        Parameters:
        x1 - starting x coordinate
        y1 - starting y coordinate
        x2 - destination x coordinate
        y2 - destination y coordinate
        obstacles - list of coordinates which the robot cannot travel on
        visited - This is a 2d boolean array which indicates which parts of the island have already been visited. The array must be (island width - 1) x (island height - 1) in size. If no array has been made, the first call generates an empty one automatically.
        Returns:
        list of adjacent coordinates that form the shortest obstacle free path

      • tunnelToTree

        public static boolean tunnelToTree(int[] startCoords,
                                   int[][] obstacles,
                                   java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> availableSides)
        This method navigates the robot to the closest available side on the tree (1 grid away).
        Parameters:
        startCoords - where the robot is when the method is called
        obstacles - list of coordinates which the robot cannot travel on
        availableSides - list of side of the tree (1 = north, 2 = east, 3 = south, 4 = west) that are accessible
        Returns:
        a boolean indicating if the robot made it to the tree immediately after exiting the tunnel, meaning localization is required to get it back on the grid

      • navAroundTree

        public int navAroundTree(int[][] obstacles,
                         java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> availableSides)
        Navigates to the nearest accessible tree side.
        Parameters:
        obstacles - list of coordinates which the robot cannot travel on
        availableSides - list of side of the tree (1 = north, 2 = east, 3 = south, 4 = west) that are accessible
        Returns:
        side that the tree navigated to, and -1 if no side was available

      • treeToTunnel

        public static void treeToTunnel(int[] destination,
                                int[][] obstacles)
        Navigates from the tree to the tunnel.
        Parameters:
        destination - grid coordinates of the robot after executing navInTunnelToIsland
        obstacles - list of coordinates which the robot cannot travel on

      • navInTunnelFromIsland

        public static void navInTunnelFromIsland(int tunnelOrientation,
                                         int[][] obstacles)
        Navigates from a grid intersection near the entrance of the tunnel to the front of the tunnel, then to the main island through the tunnel, ending up 1 grid away from the exit
        Parameters:
        tunnelOrientation - 1 = vertical & LL on starting island, 2 = vertical & LL on island, 3 = horizontal & LL on starting island, 4 = horizontal && LL on island
        obstacles - list of coordinates which the robot cannot travel on

      • tunnelToStart

        public static void tunnelToStart()
        Goes back to the start and then unloads any rings it is carrying; assumes that it is completely out of the tunnel and on the starting island

      • weirdFlexButOk

        public static void weirdFlexButOk()
        Plays a song
